sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: How Investors Are Reacting To Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) Insider Sales And A $109 Million Shelf Offering
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor recently closed a US$109.33 million shelf registration and saw a board member reduce indirect holdings via share sales. These financial maneuvers and insider transactions occur as Navitas expands its global distribution with Avnet, focusing on high-growth sectors like AI data centers and renewable energy. The article examines the potential impact of these events on Navitas’s investment narrative, particularly in light of falling revenues and ongoing losses, stressing that execution and an effective Avnet partnership are crucial for converting opportunities into sustained revenue.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS): Revisiting Valuation After a Sharp Weekly Pullback and Strong One-Year Gains
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) has seen a significant pullback of almost 20% in the past week, yet still boasts impressive year-to-date and one-year gains of 111.17% and 162.28% respectively. The stock is considered 10.9% undervalued with a narrative fair value of $8.28, despite trading at a high price-to-sales ratio relative to its industry peers. This article dives into the valuation, highlighting both the potential upside and the risks associated with its fast-growing revenues and current losses.

feed.title: Navitas Has Tumbled 55% In Two Months, But Retail Is Gaga On The Stock – ‘The Shorts Are Sitting On A Powder Keg’
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) stock has captured investor optimism despite a 55% tumble from its October high, driven by recent strategic partnerships and distribution agreements. The company is pivoting towards high-power markets with gallium nitride (GaN) and silicon carbide (SiC) technologies, aligning with GlobalFoundries and Cyient Semiconductors and expanding reach through Avnet and WT Microelectronics. Retail sentiment on Stocktwits is bullish, with some users suggesting short sellers are in a precarious position.

feed.title: Is Navitas Semiconductor Stock a Buy?
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor stock has seen significant fluctuations, with a recent rally driven by a data center deal with Nvidia. The company specializes in GaN and SiC power chips, which offer advantages over traditional silicon. However, Navitas faces a cyclical slowdown and a high valuation, despite analyst expectations for revenue growth in 2027 based on the Nvidia deal.

feed.title: Navitas semiconductor director sells $1.18 million in NVTS stock By Investing.com
feed.summary: A director at Navitas Semiconductor Corp (NASDAQ:NVTS), Gary Kent Wunderlich JR, sold 128,300 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $1.18 million. These sales occurred on December 10 and 11, 2025, after Navitas shares had seen a 150% return over the past year. Navitas has also been active with new SiC power semiconductor samples, expanded distribution with Avnet, and strategic partnerships with Cyient and GlobalFoundries.

feed.title: Navitas semi director Long sells shares worth $19.7 million
feed.summary: Brian Long, a director at Navitas Semiconductor Corp (NASDAQ:NVTS), sold nearly 3 million shares of Class A Common Stock across two days in June 2025 for approximately $19.7 million. Despite the sales occurring at prices lower than the current trading price, the company's shares have seen a significant 155% year-to-date increase. Navitas has also made recent strategic moves, including new high-voltage silicon carbide product releases, a $100 million private placement, and partnerships with GlobalFoundries and Cyient Semiconductors to expand GaN technology development and adoption.

feed.title: Is Navitas Semiconductor Stock Going to $0?
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor is developing advanced semiconductors using gallium nitride and silicon carbide, aiming for greater efficiency. Despite a recent decline in revenue due to a strategic shift away from low-margin opportunities and a transitional period, the company has a stable financial foundation with low debt and sufficient cash reserves. Partnering with Nvidia for AI factory computing suggests a promising future for Navitas, as the demand for advanced, energy-efficient semiconductors grows.

feed.title: Navitas Bets Big On AI And EV Power, Risk Remains
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor, a fabless chipmaker specializing in GaN and SiC technologies, is focusing on high-power segments like AI data centers and EVs, leading to significant stock volatility despite a substantial year-over-year return. The company faces challenges including uneven revenue, high losses, and intense competition, but its NVIDIA partnership and patent portfolio offer potential for long-term growth. Its high valuation reflects future expectations, making it a high-risk, high-reward investment.

feed.title: Navitas semiconductor director sells $462,500 in shares
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor Corp Director Gary Kent Wunderlich JR. sold 50,000 shares of the company's Class A Common Stock for $462,500. This transaction occurred on December 9, 2025, at $9.25 per share, near the stock's current trading price, following which Wunderlich directly owns 215,264 shares and indirectly 1,263,000 shares. Navitas also recently announced a $100 million private placement and launched new high-voltage silicon carbide products, alongside strategic partnerships to expand its technology and market reach.

feed.title: Glickman, Navitas semiconductor CFO, sells $765,090 in NVTS stock By Investing.com
feed.summary: Todd Glickman, CFO of Navitas Semiconductor Corp (NASDAQ:NVTS), sold 78,307 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $765,090 on December 8, 2025. Following this transaction, Glickman directly owns 813,279 shares. Navitas Semiconductor has also recently engaged in a $100 million private placement and launched new high-voltage silicon carbide (SiC) products.

feed.title: Insider Sell: Todd Glickman Sells 78,307 Shares of Navitas Semic
feed.summary: Todd Glickman, Senior Vice President, CFO, and Treasurer of Navitas Semiconductor Corp (NVTS), sold 78,307 shares on December 8, 2025. This transaction follows a pattern of significant insider selling, with 46 insider sells and only 1 insider buy over the past year. Shares were trading at $9.77, suggesting the stock is significantly overvalued compared to its GF Value of $3.75.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor CFO Sells Over 78,000 Shares
feed.summary: Todd Glickman, CFO of Navitas Semiconductor Corp (NVTS), sold 78,307 shares of Class A Common Stock for $765,090 on December 8, 2025. This transaction, occurring at a weighted-average price of $9.7704 per share, leaves Glickman with a direct ownership of 813,279 shares in the company.

feed.title: Glickman, Navitas semiconductor CFO, sells $765,090 in NVTS stock
feed.summary: Todd Glickman, CFO and Treasurer of Navitas Semiconductor Corp (NASDAQ:NVTS), sold 78,307 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $765,090 on December 8, 2025. Following this transaction, Glickman directly holds 813,279 shares. The company has also been active with strategic developments including a $100 million private placement, new high-voltage silicon carbide product launches, and partnerships to advance gallium nitride technology.

feed.title: Navitas and Cyient partner to develop GaN technology in India
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor and Cyient Semiconductors have formed a strategic partnership to advance gallium nitride (GaN) technology in India, aiming to build a complete GaN ecosystem. The collaboration will focus on co-developing GaN products for high-voltage applications in various sectors and establishing a local supply chain to support India's "Make in India" initiative. This move seeks to boost GaN adoption by providing locally sourced components and manufacturing support to Indian design houses and OEMs.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor (Nasdaq: NVTS) joins Cyient to boost GaN in India's AI and EV sectors
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (Nasdaq: NVTS) and Cyient Semiconductors have formed a long-term strategic partnership to accelerate gallium nitride (GaN) technology adoption in India. This collaboration aims to co-develop GaN products and establish a local GaN ecosystem, targeting key sectors like AI data centers, electric mobility, and industrial electrification. The initiative aligns with India's "Make in India" program, fostering a domestic supply chain and manufacturing capabilities.

feed.title: Does Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) Have a Durable Edge With Its New AEC-Plus SiC Strategy?
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor recently introduced new ultra-high voltage SiC products and an "AEC-Plus" reliability benchmark, targeting demanding applications like grid infrastructure and AI data centers. While these advancements strengthen the company's long-term positioning and manufacturing capabilities, near-term growth catalysts and the risk of ongoing losses remain key factors for investors. Community fair value estimates for Navitas stock show significant divergence, highlighting the importance of diverse perspectives in assessing its investment potential.

feed.title: This Semiconductor Stock Is Up 165% in 2025. 1 Reason This Could Be Just the Beginning.
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NASDAQ: NVTS) shares have significantly increased in 2025, driven by a strategic shift to the AI data center market despite a recent revenue decline. A key partnership with Nvidia validates Navitas' specialized products, such as Gallium Nitride (GaN) power integrated circuits. While short-term gains are not expected, this transition positions Navitas for substantial long-term growth in the high-growth AI infrastructure market.

feed.title: Navitas (NVTS) Falls 14.6% as Earnings Disappoint
feed.summary: This article reports that Navitas (NVTS) experienced a significant 14.6% drop in its stock price due to disappointing earnings. The details of the earnings report leading to this decline are not provided in the snippet.

feed.title: Should You Buy Navitas Semiconductor Stock Before 2026?
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor is transitioning its business focus from low-margin consumer device chips to high-margin AI data center markets, utilizing its GaN and SiC technologies. While analysts expect revenue and profits to decline in 2025 and 2026 during this strategic shift, the company is projected to see significant rebound and growth starting in 2027 due to increasing AI demand. This stock is considered a promising long-term investment for those patient enough to endure potential near-term volatility.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor (Nasdaq: NVTS) picks WT to lead Asian GaN, SiC distribution
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor has expanded its strategic distribution partnership with WT Microelectronics in Asia, consolidating its distributor base. WT will provide enhanced technical and commercial resources to lead customer engagement and design-in activities for Navitas's GaN and SiC power devices. This collaboration aims to improve regional logistics, product availability, and design support for key markets like AI data centers, performance computing, energy grid infrastructure, and industrial electrification.

feed.title: Navitas Stock Surges Over 300% In A Year — Here's Why It's Trending Tonight
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NASDAQ: NVTS) shares are trending after surging over 300% in a year, largely due to a recent private placement of 14.81 million shares, generating $100 million. This capital is intended to accelerate Navitas' expansion into high-power markets like AI data centers and energy infrastructure, as announced by CEO Chris Allexandre. The stock showed an after-hours increase of 12.31% following these developments.

feed.title: Why Did Navitas Semiconductor Stock Surge 9% Today?
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor stock surged 9% after announcing a strategic alliance with GlobalFoundries. This partnership aims to accelerate U.S.-based development and manufacturing of gallium nitride (GaN) technology for high-power applications, aligning with Navitas's strategic pivot to high-power markets. The collaboration will boost domestic production and provide a secure U.S.-based supply chain for critical GaN applications.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor: Rise Fueled by AI Chip Partnership?
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor Corporation's stock has risen by 13.01% due to positive market sentiment, including a 36% jump after unveiling new AI chips for NVIDIA platforms. The company is strategically shifting its focus towards high-power AI data centers and has moved to raise $100M through private stock placement. Despite a projected Q4 revenue shortfall, Navitas's strong balance sheet and focus on advanced semiconductor technologies like GaN and SiC position it for long-term growth in the evolving tech landscape.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor Stock Soars Amidst Market Buzz: Time to Buy?
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor's stock has surged to $12 in premarket trading following an announcement about its 800V architecture for Nvidia systems, despite a -10.5% downturn post-CEO resignation news. Analysts express caution due to high valuation (60-times FY26 consensus revenue) and a lack of significant new design wins, questioning the sustainability of the current stock momentum. The article highlights investor optimism for disruptive tech but advises prudence amidst speculative risks and the need for tangible earnings.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor Options Spot-On: On October 16th, 215.35K Contracts Were Traded, With 534.01K Open Interest - 富途牛牛
feed.summary: On October 16th, Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS.US) experienced significant options trading volume, with 215.35K contracts traded, where call options accounted for 73.78%. The open interest for NVTS.US options reached 534.01K contracts, which is 135.23% higher than the average of the past 30 trading days. Notably, a call option with a $15.00 strike price expiring on October 24th, 2025, was highly active, transacting 1,754 contracts for a turnover of $403.42K.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) Moves 20.6% Higher: Will This Strength Last?
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) shares surged 20.6% due to substantial progress in its collaboration with Nvidia on GaN and SiC power chips for AI data centers. Despite this rally, the company is expected to report a quarterly loss and analysts' earnings estimates have remained unchanged, prompting caution about the sustainability of the recent stock strength. Investors are advised to monitor future earnings estimate revisions for a clearer indication of sustained growth.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor Options Spot-On: On October 15th, 263.64K Contracts Were Traded, With 487.06K Open Interest - 富途牛牛
feed.summary: On October 15th, Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS.US) experienced active options trading, with a total volume of 263.64K contracts, 77.0% of which were call options. The open interest for NVTS.US reached approximately 487.06K contracts, significantly higher than its 30-day average. A notable unusual trade involved a put option with a $12.00 strike price expiring on October 17th, 2025.

feed.title: This Semiconductor Stock Soared 26% Tuesday After Launching Devices for Nvidia's AI Factory Architecture - International Business Times
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) shares surged 26% after the company launched new gallium nitride (GaN) and silicon carbide (SiC) power semiconductors designed for Nvidia's 800 VDC AI factory power architecture. These new devices aim to improve efficiency and power delivery for AI data centers by transitioning away from traditional 54V systems. Despite the stock's recent outperformance and its potential in the growing AI power demand, analysts suggest much of the upside is already priced in, with a consensus rating of 'moderate buy' but a price target implying over 50% downside.

feed.title: GigaDevice and Navitas Unveil Digital Power Joint Lab to Accelerate High-Efficiency Power Management Deployment - MarketScreener
feed.summary: GigaDevice and Navitas Semiconductor have launched a Digital Power Joint Lab to accelerate high-efficiency power management solutions for emerging markets like AI data centers and electric vehicles. The collaboration leverages GigaDevice's GD32MCU expertise and Navitas' advanced GaN and GeneSiC technologies. Prior to its official launch, the lab achieved significant milestones, including highly efficient server power supplies and a PV micro-inverter solution.

feed.title: Craig-Hallum Remains a Hold on Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS)
feed.summary: Craig-Hallum has maintained a Hold rating on Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS). The company reported a quarterly revenue of $14.49 million and a GAAP net loss of $49.08 million for the quarter ending June 30. Corporate insider sentiment is negative, with recent insider selling of shares.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor Options Spot-On: On October 14th, 273.02K Contracts Were Traded, With 433.54K Open Interest - 富途牛牛
feed.summary: On October 14th, Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS.US) saw significant options trading, with a total volume of 273.02K contracts and 433.54K open interest. Call options accounted for the majority of transactions. The article highlights an unusual call option trade and the most active option contract for NVTS.US.

feed.title: Why Is Navitas Semiconductor Stock Skyrocketing Today?
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor's stock surged over 27% after the company announced significant progress in developing next-generation power technology for Nvidia. Navitas is focused on creating highly efficient power semiconductors using gallium nitride (GaN) and silicon carbide (SiC) to meet the demanding power needs of AI data centers. While in a prime position to innovate, Navitas faces competition in this rapidly evolving sector.

feed.title: Why Is Navitas Semiconductor Stock Skyrocketing Today? - The Motley Fool
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor's stock soared 27.7% after the company announced significant progress in developing new chips for Nvidia, utilizing alternative materials like gallium nitride and silicon carbide. These materials offer enhanced efficiency for power-hungry AI data centers. While the collaboration is promising, the article cautions that future growth is already largely priced into the stock, and Navitas faces competition in this developing technology space.

feed.title: Craig-Hallum Flags Caution On Navitas Share Price Jump, Says Stock Is ‘Getting Ahead Of Itself’ - Asianet Newsable
feed.summary: Craig-Hallum has issued a cautionary note regarding Navitas Semiconductor Corp's stock price, stating it's "getting ahead of itself" after a significant jump. The firm highlighted that the company's recent 800-volt power system update is largely a reiteration of prior information and Navitas has yet to secure confirmed design wins for the platform. Despite this, Navitas's stock traded over 16% higher, becoming a top trending ticker.

feed.title: NVTS Stock Rises 90% in 3 Months: Time to Hold or Book Profits? - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) has seen its stock rally 90.3% in the past three months, driven by its focus on power chips for AI data centers and a shift to cost-efficient 8-inch GaN manufacturing. While the company faces near-term tariff challenges and has a high valuation, its long-term prospects in the expanding AI data center and energy systems markets suggest it remains an attractive hold. The article discusses Navitas' strategy to capitalize on the increasing power demands of AI and its manufacturing advancements to improve efficiency and margins.

feed.title: Craig-Hallum Maintains Navitas Semiconductor(NVTS.US) With Hold Rating - 富途牛牛
feed.summary: Craig-Hallum analyst Richard Shannon has reiterated a "Hold" rating on Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS.US). Shannon has a 56.4% success rate and a 54.3% average return over the past year according to TipRanks data. The article includes a disclaimer emphasizing that the information is for educational purposes only and not investment advice.

feed.title: NVTS Stock Rises 90% in 3 Months: Time to Hold or Book Profits? - Zacks Investment Research
feed.summary: The provided content indicates an interruption due to suspected bot activity, preventing access to the full article about NVTS stock performance. It asks the user to enable cookies and JavaScript to regain access. Therefore, no information about NVTS stock or investment advice can be extracted from this content.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor Corporation's (NASDAQ:NVTS) Shares Climb 62% But Its Business Is Yet to Catch Up
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor's shares have surged 62% in the last month and 296% annually, leading to a high price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 31.2x compared to an industry average of 5.2x. Despite the stock's strong performance, the company's revenue fell 26% last year, though it has seen a 141% rise over three years. Analysts forecast 24% annual revenue growth for Navitas Semiconductor, matching industry averages, which raises questions about its elevated P/S ratio.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor Soars 26% After Unveiling Next-Gen Power Chips for Nvidia AI Systems - Yahoo Finance
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) stock surged over 26% after the company announced new gallium nitride and silicon carbide power chips designed for Nvidia's (NVDA) 800-volt AI factory power architecture. These next-generation devices are engineered to support the increasing computational demands of AI workloads by offering higher efficiency, power density, and performance. This development strengthens Navitas's position within the rapidly expanding AI hardware ecosystem.

feed.title: Here’s Why Navitas Stock (NVTS) Is Rallying Today - TipRanks
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) stock rallied significantly after announcing advancements in its GaN and SiC power devices for Nvidia's next-generation AI factory computing platforms. The company's new 100-volt GaN FETs, 650V GaN, and high-voltage SiC devices are designed to address the power demands of Nvidia's 800 VDC AI factory architecture. This development follows a positive market reaction to U.S. President Donald Trump softening his stance on new China tariffs.

feed.title: Craig-Hallum Flags Caution On Navitas Share Price Jump, Says Stock Is 'Getting Ahead Of Itself' - Menafn.com
feed.summary: Craig-Hallum has issued a caution regarding Navitas Semiconductor Corp's stock, stating that its recent price surge to over $12 is "getting ahead of itself." The firm noted that Navitas's recent update on its 800-volt power system is largely a reiteration of previous information from May and that the company has not yet secured confirmed design wins for this platform despite the stock's significant jump.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor Shares Top 52-week High in After-Hours Trading - 富途牛牛
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) shares reached a new 52-week high in after-hours trading. This rise follows Unity Software (U.US) reporting strong fourth-quarter financial results, with revenue increasing 35% year-over-year to $609 million, surpassing analyst estimates.

feed.title: Why Navitas Semiconductor Stock Mashed the Market on Monday - The Motley Fool
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) stock surged over 21% on Monday due to two main factors: President Trump's positive statements hinting at an easing of U.S.-China trade tensions, which is significant for Navitas given its active presence in the Chinese market. Additionally, Navitas announced progress in developing power devices for Nvidia's AI-ready systems, further boosting investor confidence.

feed.title: Why Navitas Semiconductor Stock Mashed the Market on Monday - The Globe and Mail
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NASDAQ: NVTS) stock surged over 21% on Monday due to two main factors: President Trump's optimistic statements about easing U.S.-China trade tensions, which would benefit Navitas given its significant presence in the Chinese market, and the announcement of progress in developing power devices for Nvidia. The company's work with advanced semiconductor materials like gallium nitride and silicon carbide for next-generation data centers, particularly for Nvidia, further boosted investor confidence.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor Corp. Experiences Revision in Stock Evaluation Amid Strong Performance Metrics - Markets Mojo
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor Corp. has undergone a stock evaluation revision, demonstrating strong performance metrics with significant outperformance against the S&P 500 across various timeframes. The company's stock has shown impressive returns year-to-date and over the past year, although technical indicators present a mixed outlook for the small-cap player in the Other Electrical Equipment industry. Despite some bearish technical signals, overall trends suggest a favorable return profile compared to broader market indices.

feed.title: Navitas Previews Advances in GaN and SiC Technologies, Including Industry’s First 8.5 kW AI Data Center Power Supply at electronica 2024
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor (NVTS) is showcasing groundbreaking GaN and SiC technologies at electronica 2024, highlighted by the world's first 8.5 kW power supply for AI data centers using GaNSafe power ICs and Gen-3 Fast SiC MOSFETs. These new Gen-3 Fast GeneSiC MOSFETs offer significantly lower case temperatures and extended lifespan compared to competitors, contributing to higher efficiency and power density in various applications. The company anticipates GaN and SiC products will capture 30% of the power semiconductor market by 2027, emphasizing their role in advancing AI, EV, and consumer markets.

feed.title: Navitas Semiconductor Corp.: Pioneering Efficient Energy Solutions with Gallium Nitride Technology
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor Corp. is a leader in developing highly efficient energy solutions using gallium nitride (GaN) technology to create advanced GaN power ICs. These components enhance charging speeds, reduce energy consumption, and increase power density across various applications such as mobile devices, consumer electronics, data centers, eMobility, and renewable energy. The company, established in 2020 and based in Torrance, California, is focused on shaping the future of energy management through efficiency, performance, and sustainability.

feed.title: Navitas unveils plans for 8–10kW power platform supporting 2025 AI power requirements
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor is developing an 8–10kW power platform to meet the exponential power demands of AI data centers by 2025. This new platform, leveraging advanced GaN and SiC technologies, builds on their earlier 3.2kW and 4.5kW offerings, aiming for higher power density and efficiency. The company anticipates a full platform launch in Q4 2024, addressing the critical power challenge posed by rapidly advancing AI processors.

feed.title: Navitas Powers Samsung Galaxy S24 with Integrated AI
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor announced that its GaNFast™ power ICs are used in Samsung’s 25W “Super-Fast Charging” (SFC) for the new AI-enhanced Galaxy S24 smartphone. This technology enables a compact and efficient charger that delivers a 50% charge to the phone's battery in just 30 minutes, while also being compatible with other Samsung devices. The GaNFast™ technology allows for a 30% size reduction compared to conventional charger designs and a 75% reduction in power consumption during sleep mode.

feed.title: Navitas “Electrify Our World™” with Next-Gen GaN & SiC Semiconductors at Taiwan Investor Meeting
feed.summary: Navitas Semiconductor will participate in a virtual Taiwan Investor Meeting on August 15th (US Eastern time) to review Q2 2023 results and discuss product, manufacturing, and market developments. CEO Gene Sheridan and CFO Ron Shelton will highlight the company's mission to accelerate the transition to renewable energy through its GaNFast™ and GeneSiC™ power semiconductors, targeting markets such as EV, solar, and data centers. The meeting will include a presentation and live Q&A session.
